methods.name: asType
methods.comment:
Converter method for converting a byte array into a Blob or ShortBlob instance 

 "some byte".getBytes() as Blob
 "some byte".getBytes() as ShortBlob
methods.shortComment:
Converter method for converting a byte array into a Blob or ShortBlob instance 

 "some byte".getBytes() as Blob
 "some byte".getBytes() as ShortBlob

Transform a byte array into an Image.

def image = byteArray.image

methods.name: getImage
methods.comment:
Fetch an image stored in the blobstore. 

def image = blobKey.image
// equivalent of ImagesServiceFactory.makeImageFromBlob(selfKey)

Note that this creates an image object only with the blob key set, it's not retrieving the image data right away, nor the dimensions of the image.
methods.shortComment: Fetch an image stored in the blobstore.

methods.name: getInfo
methods.comment:
Get the BlobInfo associated with a blob key with: 

 blobKey.info
methods.shortComment:
Get the BlobInfo associated with a blob key with: 

 blobKey.info

methods.name: getServingUrl
methods.shortComment: Obtains a URL that can serve the image stored as a blob dynamically.
methods.returnComment: a URL that can serve the image dynamically.

parameters.name: a
parameters.comment: Map of options retries - the number of times to retry upon failure. onRetry - a closure that is called upon each retry attempt. Takes 2 parameters: 1. causing exception 2. # retries Closure must return true in order to continue otherwise no more retries will be attempted and onFail will be returned. If no onFail is specified, null will be returned as the URL. onFail - a closure that is called if serving url could not be retrieved successfully. Takes 1 parameter: causing exception Note: if you don't pass an onFail closure, the underlying exception will propagate out otherwise the result of onFail will be returned as the URL.

methods.name: serve
methods.comment: Serve a range of the blob to the response.
methods.shortComment: Serve a range of the blob to the response.

parameters.name: the
parameters.comment: response on which to serve the blob

methods.name: serve
methods.comment: Serve a range of the blob to the response.
methods.shortComment: Serve a range of the blob to the response.

parameters.comment: response on which to serve the blob

methods.comment: Serve a range of the blob to the response.

methods.name: withReader
methods.comment:
Creates a (buffered) Reader over the blob with a specified encoding. The reader is passed as parameter of the closure. This methods takes care of properly opening and closing the reader and underlying stream. You can use this method as follows: 

blobKey.withReader("UTF-8") { reader -> ... }
methods.shortComment: Creates a (buffered) Reader over the blob with a specified encoding.
methods.returnComment: the return value of the closure execution
methods.parametersDocUrl: String encoding, Closure c

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.comment: the encoding used to read from the stream (UTF-8, etc.)

parameters.name: c
parameters.comment: the closure to execute, passing in the stream as parameter of the closure

methods.name: withReader
methods.comment:
Creates a (buffered) Reader over the blob using UTF-8 as default encoding. The reader is passed as parameter of the closure. This methods takes care of properly opening and closing the reader and underlying stream. You can use this method as follows: 

 blobKey.withReader { reader -> ... }
methods.shortComment: Creates a (buffered) Reader over the blob using UTF-8 as default encoding.
methods.returnComment: the return value of the closure execution

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.comment: the encoding used to read from the stream (UTF-8, etc.)

parameters.name: c
parameters.comment: the closure to execute, passing in the stream as parameter of the closure

methods.name: withStream
methods.comment:
Creates an InputStream over the blob. The stream is passed as parameter of the closure. This methods takes care of properly opening and closing the stream. You can use this method as follows: 

blobKey.withStream { inputstream -> ... }
methods.shortComment: Creates an InputStream over the blob.
methods.returnComment: the return value of the closure execution

parameters.name: c
parameters.comment: the closure to execute, passing in the stream as parameter of the closure

methods.name: collect
methods.comment:
Collect all the BlobInfos of the blobs stored in the blobstore. 

    blobstore.each { BlobInfo info -> ... }
methods.shortComment: Collect all the BlobInfos of the blobs stored in the blobstore.

parameters.name: c
parameters.comment: the closure passed to the collect method

methods.name: each
methods.comment:
Iterates over all the BlobInfos of the blobs stored in the blobstore. 

     def filenames = blobstore.collect { BlobInfo info -> info.filename }
methods.shortComment: Iterates over all the BlobInfos of the blobs stored in the blobstore.

parameters.name: c
parameters.comment: the closure passed to the each method

methods.name: getAt
methods.comment:
Query the status of the various App Engine services. 

import static com.google.appengine.api.capabilities.Capability.*
import static com.google.appengine.api.capabilities.CapabilityStatus.*

capabilities[DATASTORE] == ENABLED
methods.shortComment: Query the status of the various App Engine services.

methods.name: asBoolean
methods.comment: Coerces a capability status into a boolean. This mechanism is used by the "Groovy Truth".
methods.shortComment: Coerces a capability status into a boolean.
methods.returnComment: true if the capability status is ENABLED, otherwise false.

methods.name: asType
methods.comment:
Gaelyk supports a simplistic object/entity mapping, thanks to type coercion. You can use this type coercion mechanism to coerce POJOs/POGOs and datastore Entities. The Entity kind will be the simple name of the POJO/POGO (same approach as Objectify). So with this mechanism, you can do: 

 class Person { String name, int age }

 def e = new Entity("Person")
 e.name = "Guillaume"
 e.age = 33

 def p = e as Person

 assert e.name == p.name
 assert e.age == p.age
methods.shortComment: Gaelyk supports a simplistic object/entity mapping, thanks to type coercion.
methods.returnComment: an instance of a POJO/POGO to coerce into

methods.name: asyncDelete
methods.comment: Delete this entity from the data store. Usage: entity.asyncDelete()
methods.shortComment: Delete this entity from the data store.

methods.comment: Save this entity in the data store asynchronously. Usage: entity.asyncSave()
methods.shortComment: Save this entity in the data store asynchronously.

methods.comment: Provides a shortcut notation to get a property of an entity. Instead of writing entity.getProperty('propertyName') You can use the shortcut entity['propertyName']

methods.name: withTransaction
methods.comment: With this method, transaction handling is done transparently. The transaction is committed if the Closure executed properly. The transaction is rollbacked if anything went wrong. You can use this method as follows: datastore.withTransaction { transaction -> // do something in that transaction }
methods.shortComment: With this method, transaction handling is done transparently.

methods.name: withTransaction
methods.comment:
With this method, transaction handling is done transparently. The transaction is committed if the Closure executed properly. The transaction is rollbacked if anything went wrong. If you want to use cross-group transactions, pass {@literal true} as an argument.

You can use this method as follows: datastore.withTransaction(true) { transaction -> // do something in that transaction }
methods.shortComment: With this method, transaction handling is done transparently.
methods.parametersDocUrl: boolean crossGroup, Closure c

methods.name: withTransaction
methods.comment: With this method, transaction handling is done transparently. The transaction is committed if the Closure executed properly. The transaction is rollbacked if anything went wrong. You can use this method as follows: datastore.async.withTransaction { transactionFuture -> // do something in that transaction }
methods.shortComment: With this method, transaction handling is done transparently.

methods.name: withTransaction
methods.comment:
With this method, transaction handling is done transparently. The transaction is committed if the Closure executed properly. The transaction is rollbacked if anything went wrong. If you want to use cross-group transactions, pass {@literal true} as an argument.

You can use this method as follows: datastore.withTransaction(true) { transactionFuture -> // do something in that transaction }
methods.shortComment: With this method, transaction handling is done transparently.
methods.parametersDocUrl: boolean crossGroup, Closure c

methods.name: withTransactionCommitAsync
methods.comment: With this method, transaction handling is done transparently. The transaction is asynchronously committed if the Closure executed properly. The transaction is rollbacked if anything went wrong. You can use this method as follows: datastore.async.withTransactionCommitAsync { transactionFuture -> // do something in that transaction }
methods.shortComment: With this method, transaction handling is done transparently.
methods.returnComment: Future<Void> calling .get() blocks until all oustanding async calls have completed

parameters.name: closure

methods.name: withOutputStream

parameters.comment: an optional map containing two possible keys: locked (a boolean, if you want to acquire a write lock on the file -- false by default), finalize (a boolean, if you want to close the file definitively -- false by default).

parameters.comment: the closure with the output stream as parameter

methods.name: leftShift
methods.comment:
Use the leftShift operator, <<, to concatenate a transform to the composite transform. 

def cropTransform = ...
def rotateTransform = ...

croptTransform << rotateTransform
methods.shortComment: Use the leftShift operator, <<, to concatenate a transform to the composite transform.

methods.name: rightShift
methods.comment:
Use the rightShift operator, >>, to "pre-concatenate" a transform to the composite transform. 

def cropTransform = ...
def rotateTransform = ...

croptTransform >> rotateTransform
methods.shortComment: Use the rightShift operator, >>, to "pre-concatenate" a transform to the composite transform.

methods.name: crop
methods.comment:
Create a new cropped image. 

 def cropped = image.crop(0.1, 0.1, 0.9, 0.9)
methods.shortComment: Create a new cropped image.
methods.parametersDocUrl: double leftX, double topY, double rightX, double bottomY

methods.name: horizontalFlip
methods.comment:
Create a new image flipped horizontally. 

 def himage = image.horizontalFlip()
methods.shortComment: Create a new image flipped horizontally.

methods.name: imFeelingLucky
methods.comment:
Create a new image applying the "I'm feeling lucky" transformation. 

 def adjusted = image.iAmFeelingLucky()
methods.shortComment: Create a new image applying the "I'm feeling lucky" transformation.

methods.name: resize
methods.comment:
Create a new resized image. 

 def thumbnail = image.resize(100, 100)
methods.shortComment: Create a new resized image.

methods.name: rotate
methods.comment:
Create a new rotated image. 

 def rotated = image.rotate(90)
methods.shortComment: Create a new rotated image.

parameters.name: degrees
parameters.comment: number of degrees to rotate (must be a multiple of 90)

methods.name: transform
methods.comment:
Image transform DSL. 

 bytes.image.transform {
     resize 100, 100
     crop 0.1, 0.1, 0.9, 0.9
     flip horizontal
     flip vertical
     rotate 90
     feeling lucky
 }
methods.shortComment: Image transform DSL.

parameters.name: c
parameters.comment: the closure containg the various transform steps

methods.name: verticalFlip
methods.comment:
Create a new image flipped vertically. 

 def vimage = image.verticalFlip()
methods.shortComment: Create a new image flipped vertically.

methods.name: put
methods.comment: Put an object in the cache under a Object key, coerced to a String, with an expiration and a SetPolicy, ignoring any exceptions.

Get a search service instance restricted to a given namespace.

methods.name: add
methods.comment:
Add a new task on the queue using a map for holding the task attributes instead of a TaskOptions builder object.

Allowed keys are:

  • countdownMillis
  • etaMillis
  • headers (a map of key/value pairs)
  • method (can be 'GET', 'POST', 'PUT', 'DELETE', 'HEAD' or an enum of TaskOptions.Method)
  • params (a map of key/value parameters)
  • payload
  • taskName
  • url
methods.shortComment: Add a new task on the queue using a map for holding the task attributes instead of a TaskOptions builder object.

methods.name: addAsync
methods.comment:
Adds a new task on the queue asynchronously using a map for holding the task attributes instead of a TaskOptions builder object.

Allowed keys are:

  • countdownMillis
  • etaMillis
  • headers (a map of key/value pairs)
  • method (can be 'GET', 'POST', 'PUT', 'DELETE', 'HEAD' or an enum of TaskOptions.Method)
  • params (a map of key/value parameters)
  • payload
  • taskName
  • url
methods.shortComment: Adds a new task on the queue asynchronously using a map for holding the task attributes instead of a TaskOptions builder object.

methods.name: getName
methods.comment:
Shortcut to get the name of the Queue.

Instead of having to call queue.getQueueName() or queue.queueName, you can use the syntax queue.name which is more concise.
methods.shortComment: Shortcut to get the name of the Queue.

methods.name: leftShift
methods.comment:
Add a new task on the queue using a map for holding the task attributes instead of a TaskOptions builder object. This method adds a << operator on the Queue for adding new tasks to it.

Allowed keys are:

  • countdownMillis
  • etaMillis
  • headers (a map of key/value pairs)
  • method (can be 'GET', 'POST', 'PUT', 'DELETE', 'HEAD' or an enum of TaskOptions.Method)
  • params (a map of key/value parameters)
  • payload
  • taskName
  • url
methods.shortComment: Add a new task on the queue using a map for holding the task attributes instead of a TaskOptions builder object.

methods.name: parsePresence
methods.comment: Override the GAE SDK XMPPService#parsePresence as it hard-codes the path for the presence handler, thus preventing from using Gaelyk's routing to point at our own handler.
methods.shortComment: Override the GAE SDK XMPPService#parsePresence as it hard-codes the path for the presence handler, thus preventing from using Gaelyk's routing to point at our own handler.

methods.name: parseSubscription
methods.comment: Override the GAE SDK XMPPService#parseSubscription as it hard-codes the path for the subscription handler, thus preventing from using Gaelyk's routing to point at our own handler.
methods.shortComment: Override the GAE SDK XMPPService#parseSubscription as it hard-codes the path for the subscription handler, thus preventing from using Gaelyk's routing to point at our own handler.

methods.name: send
methods.comment:
Send an XMPP/Jabber message with the XMPP service using a map of attributes to build the message.

Possible attributes are:

  • from: the sender Jabber ID represented as a String
  • to: a String or a list of String representing recepients' Jabber IDs
  • type: an instance of the MessageType enum, or a String representation ('CHAT', 'ERROR', 'GROUPCHAT', 'HEADLINE', 'NORMAL')
  • body: a String representing the raw text to send
  • xml: a closure representing the XML you want to send (serialized using StreamingMarkupBuilder)
methods.shortComment: Send an XMPP/Jabber message with the XMPP service using a map of attributes to build the message.

methods.name: sendInvitation
methods.comment: Send a chat invitation to a Jabber ID.
methods.shortComment: Send a chat invitation to a Jabber ID.

methods.name: sendInvitation
methods.comment: Send a chat invitation to a Jabber ID from another Jabber ID.
methods.shortComment: Send a chat invitation to a Jabber ID from another Jabber ID.
methods.parametersDocUrl: String jabberIdTo, String jabberIdFrom

parameters.name: jabberIdFrom
parameters.comment: the Jabber ID to use to send the invitation request

methods.name: getFrom
methods.comment: Get the sender Jabber ID of the message in the form of a String.
methods.shortComment: Get the sender Jabber ID of the message in the form of a String.
methods.returnComment: the Jabber ID of the sender

methods.name: getRecipients
methods.comment: Gets the list of recipients of this message in the form of a list of Jabber ID strings.
methods.shortComment: Gets the list of recipients of this message in the form of a list of Jabber ID strings.
methods.returnComment: a list of Jabber ID strings

methods.name: xml
methods.comment: Get the XML content of this message (if it's an XML message) in the form of a DOM parsed with XmlSlurper.
methods.shortComment: Get the XML content of this message (if it's an XML message) in the form of a DOM parsed with XmlSlurper.

methods.name: isSuccessful
methods.comment: Checks the status of the sending of the message was successful for all its recipients
methods.shortComment: Checks the status of the sending of the message was successful for all its recipients

methods.name: asType
methods.comment:
Converter method for converting strings into various GAE specific types. 

 "foo@bar.com" as Email
 "http://www.google.com" as Link
 "+3361234543" as PhoneNumber
 "50 avenue de la Madeleine, Paris" as PostalAddress
 "groovy" as DatastoreCategory
 "32" as Rating
 "long text" as Text
 "foobar" as BlobKey
 "foo@gmail.com" as JID
 "agR0ZXN0cg8LEgdwZXJzb25zIgJtZQw" as Key
Also converts single String to String array with one element.
methods.shortComment: Converter method for converting strings into various GAE specific types.
methods.returnComment: String converted to given object if possible

methods.name: asType
methods.comment:
Converter method for converting an integer into a Rating instance 

 32 as Rating
methods.shortComment:
Converter method for converting an integer into a Rating instance

methods.name: asType
methods.comment: Perform cast on last item of String array if expected class is not array or collection. This method should handle situation when multiple params are submitted but only one value is expected. The first value is used for this purpose.

methods.returnComment: first value cast to desired type if the desired type is not array or collection

methods.name: multiply
methods.comment:
Creates RetryingFuture from the closure.

Allows following notation to create retrying closure:

Future result = 3 * { index.searchAsync('a=b') } Closure must return Future.
methods.shortComment: Creates RetryingFuture from the closure.
methods.returnComment: future which will first retries for particular times before throwing the exception

methods.name: asType
methods.comment:
Gaelyk supports a simplistic object/entity mapping, thanks to type coercion. You can use this type coercion mechanism to coerce POJOs/POGOs and datastore Entities. The Entity kind will be the simple name of the POJO/POGO (same approach as Objectify). So with this mechanism, you can do: 

 class Person { String name, int age }

 def p = new Person(name: "Guillaume", age: 33)
 def e = p as Entity

 assert p.name == e.name
 assert p.age == e.age
methods.shortComment: Gaelyk supports a simplistic object/entity mapping, thanks to type coercion.

methods.name: asyncGet
methods.comment: Fetch the entities associated with the collection of keys from the async datastore. Usage: def entitiesFuture = [key1, key2].asyncGet()
methods.shortComment: Fetch the entities associated with the collection of keys from the async datastore.
methods.returnComment: a map of key and future entity

methods.name: get
methods.comment: Fetch the entities associated with the collection of keys from the datastore. Usage: def entities = [key1, key2].get()
methods.shortComment: Fetch the entities associated with the collection of keys from the datastore.

methods.name: toQueryString
methods.comment:
Transforms a map of key / value pairs into a properly URL encoded query string. 

 assert "title=Gaelyk" == [title: "Gaelyk"].toQueryString()
methods.shortComment: Transforms a map of key / value pairs into a properly URL encoded query string.
methods.returnComment: a query string represenging the input map

methods.name: asType
methods.comment:
Converter method for converting a pair of numbers (in a list) into a GeoPt instance: 

 [45.32, 54.54f] as GeoPt
Or to convert a list of elements into a Key, avoiding the usage of KeyFactory.createKey(): 

 [parentKey, 'address', 333] as Key
 [parentKey, 'address', 'name'] as Key
 ['address', 444] as Key
 ['address', 'name'] as Key
methods.shortComment:
Converter method for converting a pair of numbers (in a list) into a GeoPt instance: 

 [45.32, 54.54f] as GeoPt
Or to convert a list of elements into a Key, avoiding the usage of KeyFactory.createKey(): 

 [parentKey, 'address', 333] as Key
 [parentKey, 'address', 'name'] as Key
 ['address', 444] as Key
 ['address', 'name'] as Key

methods.name: asType
methods.comment:
Gaelyk supports a simplistic object/entity mapping, thanks to type coercion. You can use this type coercion mechanism to coerce POJOs/POGOs and datastore Entities. The Future kind will be the simple name of the POJO/POGO (same approach as Objectify). So with this mechanism, you can do: 

 class Person { String name, int age }

 def e = key.asyncGet()

 def p = e as Person

 assert e.name == p.name
 assert e.age == p.age
methods.shortComment: Gaelyk supports a simplistic object/entity mapping, thanks to type coercion.
methods.returnComment: an instance of a POJO/POGO to coerce into

methods.shortComment: Make the set access to Future properties transparent without calling get().

parameters.name: value
parameters.comment: the new value for the property

methods.name: getHeaders
methods.comment:
Adds a fake getHeaders() method to HttpServletResponse. It allows the similar subscript notation syntax of request, but for setting or overriding a header on the response (ie. calling response.setHeader()). It also allows the leftShift notation for adding a header to the response (ie. calling response.addHeader(). 

 // sets or overrides the header 'a'
 response.headers['a'] == 'b'

 // adds an additional value to an existing header
 // or sets a first value for a non-existant header
 response.headers['a'] << 'b'
methods.shortComment: Adds a fake getHeaders() method to HttpServletResponse.
methods.returnComment: a custom map on which you can use the subscript notation to add headers

methods.name: parseXmppFormData
methods.comment: Parse the form-data from the Jabber requests, as it contains useful information like presence and subscription details, etc.
methods.shortComment: Parse the form-data from the Jabber requests, as it contains useful information like presence and subscription details, etc.
methods.returnComment: a map containing form-data key value pairs
